page.title: 05LANDSCAPES - CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: Eighty years ago the area was essentially concerned with farming and to a lesser extent, because of its geographical position, with catering to the needs of people travelling to London from the North and vice versa. Apart from modern housing, there are examples of Medieval, Georgian and Victorian styles of building which use local red brick with tiled or slated roofs - some of outstanding beauty. In the last fifty years and particularly in recent years, farming has given way to a significant amount of residential growth. This has been exacerbated by the proximity to London and the building of motorways nearby which permits greater flexibility of movement.
